citation.article-title: Filobacillus milensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a new halophilic spore-forming bacterium with Orn-D-Glu-type peptidoglycan.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Filobacillus (Fi.lo.ba.cil'lus. L. masc. n. filum thread; L. n. bacillus rod; M.L. n. Filobacillus a thread-like rod)
Cells are 0.3-0.4x3-7 μm and stain Gram-negative, but the cell wall is of the Gram-positive type.
Spores are spherical and are located terminally.
Does not grow (or grows very poorly) in media without the addition of NaCl.
Acid is not produced from D-glucose.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
The cell wall contains an L-Orn-D-Glu type murein (variation A4β).
The G­C content of the DNA is 35 mol%.
The type species is Filobacillus milensis.

As determined by 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus Filobacillus is located on the periphery of rRNA group 1 Bacillus and is phylogenetically most closely related to Bacillus haloalkaliphilus.
